DataElement.preferredName: Hyperbilirubinemia Immunology Reaction Present Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes or no response to indicate whether there is abnormally high level of bilirubin in the blood with indicators of immunological reaction.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Abnormally high level of bilirubin in the blood. Excess bilirubin is associated with jaundice._The study of the body's immune system._A response generated by a stimulus._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Abnormally high level of bilirubin in the blood. Excess bilirubin is associated with jaundice.

Concepts.definition: Abnormally high level of bilirubin in the blood. Excess bilirubin is associated with jaundice.

Property.preferredDefinition: The study of the body's immune system.:A response generated by a stimulus.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: The study of the immune system and its reaction to pathogens, as well as its malfunctions (autoimmune diseases, allergies, rejection of organ transplants).
A response generated by a stimulus.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient had any incre
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had any increases in bilirubin with indicators of immunological reaction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had any elevation of bilirubin, regardless of ALT or AST levels, and with indicators of immunological reaction (i.e., rash or >5% eosinophilia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the past 2 weeks, has the patient had any elevation of direct bilirubin > ULN, regardless of ALT or AST levels, and with indicators of immunological reaction (i.e., rash or >5% eosinophilia)?
